class_e_01_battle_01:
Osu! Say hello to your battle instructor—
The one! The only! The hot-blooded Dendra!\c
“Osu” is a karate thing, by the way. Look it up![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_02:
My age? 25! My hobby? Working out!
My...type?! Well...[npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_03: Strong and muscular Fighting types, of course![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_04:
That’s all for my introduction! As for my class,
this is where you all get to learn the nitty-gritty\r
of Pokémon battling![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_05:
We’ll start with the basics so that no Trainer gets
left in the dust! Even if you’re new to this stuff,\r
have no fear![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_06:
Leave it to me and my muscles, and you’ll be
pros in no time.\c
Let’s set our fighting spirits ablaze—together![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_07:
Pokémon have all kinds of attack moves at their
disposal, and each move has certain qualities\r
that you’ll want to remember![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_08:
I’m talking about the power, type, and [clr:6]category[clr:0]
of these moves![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_09:
Higher power means more damage—especially if
your opponent is weak to that move’s type![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_10:
Heads up, new kid! Question coming your way!\c
There are two categories that attack moves can
fall under. Know what they are?[npcn:24]
class_e_01_select_01: Moves of light and moves of darkness
class_e_01_select_03: Moves you love and moves you hate
class_e_01_battle_answer_01:
That’s not only wrong—it’s totally out there!\c
Are you OK, new kid?! Or are you just at that
age where you’re really into fantasy stuff?[npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_answer_02:
Awesome! You’re just as sharp as I expected, new
kid! Looks like you have a handle on the basics![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_answer_03:
That’s not only wrong—it’s kinda sad!\c
Are you OK, new kid?! Or are you just at that
age where you’re really into bittersweet stuff?[npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_11:
Anyway, attack moves are split into two
categories—[clr:6]physical[clr:0] and [clr:6]special[clr:0]![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_12:
Physical moves do more damage the higher the
Pokémon’s [clr:6]Attack[clr:0] stat is![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_13:
And special moves do more damage the higher
the Pokémon’s [clr:6]Sp. Atk[clr:0] stat is![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_14:
On the other side of things, Pokémon getting hit
by these moves can take less damage by having\r
a high [clr:6]Defense[clr:0] or [clr:6]Sp. Def [clr:0]stat, respectively![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_16:
Pokémon that are good with [clr:6]physical moves[clr:0]
should raise their [clr:6]Attack[clr:0] stat!\c
And Pokémon that are good with [clr:6]special moves[clr:0]
should raise their [clr:6]Sp. Atk[clr:0] stat![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_17:
Trying to raise both of these stats equally will just
make it hard for the Pokémon to shine in battle![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_18:
Make your strong points stronger, I always say—
that goes for both people and Pokémon![npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_19:
Aw, man! I was just about to suggest we do some
hands-on practice to really drive the point home,\r
but I guess we’re out of time...[npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_20:
We’ll generally meet for my class here in the
schoolyard—even for book learning!\c
Nothing like a little fresh air to make studying
more fun, am I right?[npcn:24]
class_e_01_battle_21:
But class is over for now! Take care, you little
rascals![npcn:24]
